com.github.lucapino.confluence.helpers

Class ConfluenceClient.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.lucapino.confluence.helpers.ConfluenceClient.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    ConfluenceClient

    public static class ConfluenceClient.Builder
extends Object
    A Builder factory for implementing the Builder Pattern.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConfluenceClient.Builder baseURL(String url)
      By default, BaseURL will be used as the url of the confluence instance; when this is set, requests will be made to this base URL instead.

      Build and return a configured ConfluenceClient instance.

      • baseURL

        public ConfluenceClient.Builder baseURL(String url)
        By default, BaseURL will be used as the url of the confluence instance; when this is set, requests will be made to this base URL instead.
        Parameters:
        url - the alternative Base url of the confluence instance to make requests to.
        Returns:
        this.

      • supplyClient

        public ConfluenceClient.Builder supplyClient(okhttp3.OkHttpClient client)
        This provides a way for users to supply their own implementation of the underlying OkHttpClient. For example, to use OkHttpClient within a proxy environment: 
        
  // example proxy setup
  final Proxy proxy = new Proxy(Proxy.Type.HTTP, new InetSocketAddress("10.0.0.1", 8080));
  // setup your client to use the proxy
  final OkHttpClient httpClient = new OkHttpClient();
  httpClient.setProxy(proxy);
  // finally build the ConfluenceClient
  ConfluenceClient.builder()
      // other methods omitted for brevity...
      .supplyClient(new OkClient(httpClient))
      .build();
        Parameters:
        client - the OkHttpClient to use.
        Returns:
        this.

      • build

        public ConfluenceClient build()
        Build and return a configured ConfluenceClient instance.
        Returns:
        a configured ConfluenceClient instance.
